intro: Potamogeton muricatus, commonly known as the rough pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It has long, cylindrical stems that are often branched and bear small, spirally arranged leaves. The leaves are typically narrow and have a rough, serrated edge, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spike-like inflorescences. This plant plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
